connector.description:
Send data to a Microsoft SQL Server Database.

In your KameletBinding file, you must explicitly declare the SQL Server driver dependency in spec->integration->dependencies

- "mvn:com.microsoft.sqlserver:mssql-jdbc:<version>"

This Kamelet expects a JSON-formatted body. Use key:value pairs to map the JSON fields and parameters. For example, here is a query:

'INSERT INTO accounts (username,city) VALUES (:#username,:#city)'

Here is example input for the example query:

'{ "username":"oscerd", "city":"Rome"}'

camel.kamelet.sqlserver-sink.serverName.name: camel.kamelet.sqlserver-sink.serverName
camel.kamelet.sqlserver-sink.serverName.description: The server name for the data source. Example: localhost

camel.kamelet.sqlserver-sink.serverPort.name: camel.kamelet.sqlserver-sink.serverPort
camel.kamelet.sqlserver-sink.serverPort.description: The server port for the data source.

camel.kamelet.sqlserver-sink.username.name: camel.kamelet.sqlserver-sink.username
camel.kamelet.sqlserver-sink.username.description: The username to access a secured SQL Server Database.

camel.kamelet.sqlserver-sink.password.name: camel.kamelet.sqlserver-sink.password
camel.kamelet.sqlserver-sink.password.description: The password to access a secured SQL Server Database.

camel.kamelet.sqlserver-sink.query.name: camel.kamelet.sqlserver-sink.query
camel.kamelet.sqlserver-sink.query.description: The query to execute against the SQL Server Database. Example: INSERT INTO accounts (username,city) VALUES (:#username,:#city)

camel.kamelet.sqlserver-sink.databaseNam.name: camel.kamelet.sqlserver-sink.databaseName
camel.kamelet.sqlserver-sink.databaseNam.description: The name of the SQL Server Database.
